Men's Basketball Drive for Excellence
SMU's arrival into the ACC marks a new chapter in history, placing SMU Athletics back in a power conference. With the naming of Andy Enfield as the new Men's Basketball Head Coach, SMU Athletics continues to build on its legacy of achievement.
Upgrading the Men's Basketball facilities is a crucial step in providing student-athletes with the tools and resources they need to excel. By investing in enhanced team and support spaces, SMU donors will drive the momentum of SMU Men's Basketball in the ACC era.
Expected Impact:
- Optimize performance through pregame preparation and postgame recovery
- Enhance teambuilding and collaboration through player-centered spaces
- Attract top-tier student-athletes with upgraded facilities and staff support
- Foster internal and external partnerships and innovative ways to engage SMU players and fans
For more information about the Men's Basketball Drive for Excellence and giving opportunities to SMU Athletics, please contact:
- Joshua Whittenburg
- Associate Athletic Director for Development
- 214-768-3315 or
- jwhittenburg@smu.edu
With your gift of $50 or more to the Mothers and Dads Club Special Projects Fund, you'll help transform the future of various student organizations and bring home some school spirit from the Hilltop with an exclusive bag of swag. Your gift will leave a lasting impact on the Mustang community, and you'll receive a fun bag full of SMU spirit to celebrate our school. Let's come together to help build the future of our students and empower the next generation of leaders.

ACC Competitiveness Campaign
Your gift helps SMU compete in the Atlantic Coast Conference. Gifts to the ACC Competitiveness Campaign provide enhanced support for our student-athletes and coaches and ensure we can effectively recruit, retain, train, teach and compete for championships in the ACC.
Thank you for investing in the future of SMU Athletics.
Drive for Five
On July 1, SMU officially joined the Atlantic Coast Conference. As we prepare for our first season as members of the ACC, we hope to provide enhanced support for our student-athletes and coaches.
Together, we have increased Mustang Club membership way beyond our previous all-time record of 3,500. So now we have our sights set on a new goal: a Drive for Five, reaching 5,000 members to be competitive with our ACC peers.
Be a part of the Drive for Five with a gift to the ACC Competitiveness Campaign. Gifts to the ACC Competitiveness Campaign at the giving levels listed below count towards your Mustang Club membership and have additional perks. The ACC Competitiveness Campaign benefits include limited edition SMU x ACC branded items and merchandise.
Thank you for helping us reach our Drive for Five goal! The last day to receive Drive for Five ACC Fund benefits is August 1, 2024.
ACC Competitiveness Campaign Levels & Benefits
- $1,000: Window cling, Journal, Hat, Tumbler, 4 Priority Points ($955 tax deductible portion)
- $500: Window cling, Journal, Hat, 3 Priority Points ($470 tax deductible portion)
- $250: Window cling, Journal, 2 Priority Points ($235 tax deductible portion)
- $75: Window cling, 1 Priority Point
- $25 (Student): Window cling
** To receive credit for student benefits, you must submit a picture of your SMU student ID to the Mustang Club at mustangs@smu.edu. **

Your gift will leave a lasting impact on the Mustang community, and you'll receive a unique keepsake to cherish the memories of your alma mater. Gifts of $100 or more made to the Cox School Renovation and Expansion Fund will be eligible for the LEGO set. There are only 500 sets available, so order now and snag your kit before they're gone. LEGO sets are expected to arrive mid-summer.
Simmons 25 by 25 Initiative
Your gift to this scholarship program enables the Simmons School of Education and Human Development to recruit and retain outstanding graduate students.
Although more than 60% of Simmons students receive scholarship support each year, affordability remains the top barrier for educators who want to pursue an advanced degree. By 2025, the Simmons School seeks to address more unmet need by securing 25 new scholarships of $25,000 or more – raising $1 million for graduate student scholarships.
We invite you to take part in this critical initiative. Shape the future of education and school leadership in Dallas and beyond by supporting extraordinary teachers who impact countless students.
2025 SMU Traditions Ornament
With your gift of $35 or more to SMU Fund for Greatest Needs, you will receive a commemorative ornament celebrating the spirit of the Boulevard. Ornaments will begin shipping on December 1. To receive multiple ornaments, please make your gift in increments of $35.
For example:
1 ornament = $35
2 ornaments = $70
3 ornaments = $105
For ornaments ordered after December 12, we can't guarantee they will arrive by Christmas, but we'll do our very best!

UPDATE: Thanks to the generosity of Mustangs this season, we have SOLD OUT of our 2025 SMU Traditions Ornament. As of 12 p.m. CT on December 12, this year's ornament promotion has officially ended. Mustang Club giving opportunities
Donations to the Mustang Club play a vital role in supporting SMU's 484 student-athletes as they pursue excellence — in the classroom, in competition, and in life. Your generosity also helps fund critical facility enhancements and need-based projects that elevate the experience for all involved in SMU Athletics.
Mustang Club members — alumni, fans, letterwinners, coaches, and friends — are united in their passion for Mustang Athletics and their commitment to our 17 varsity sports.
Membership benefits, including access to hospitality areas and priority parking for season ticket holders, begin at just $100. Members also earn Priority Points, which determine access to postseason events and the seat upgrade process.
Thank you for helping to Shape Champions at SMU!

- Mustang Excellence Funds for each sport — Benefit or enhance a specific program's greatest need for the upcoming year, such as recruiting, team travel or special equipment.
- Life After Ball — Life After Ball is the program that assists our athletes with the transition from their sport to the professional world upon graduation.

Mustang Excellence Funds
While Mustang Club donations directly impact the success of our student-athletes and enhance program operations for each of our 17 teams, there is also an opportunity to donate directly to a specific program through each sport's Mustang Excellence Fund. Formerly referred to as the "Friends of" Accounts, Excellence Funds allow your gift to be specifically designated for a particular sports program. Any gift to a specific Excellence Fund will count towards your priority points total and can increase your priority point rank.
Mustang Excellence Funds are used to benefit or enhance the specific program's greatest need for that particular year. As an example, recruiting needs for a particular year may exceed a particular sport's budgeted dollars. The program's Excellence Fund could supplement those costs and maximize competitive recruiting opportunities. Excellence funds are also applied to supplement team travel, special equipment purchases, or a variety of other unforeseen operational expenses.
For specific information on a program's Excellence Fund, please contact the Mustang Club office at (214) SMU-CLUB (768-2582).
Give to Friends of SMU Libraries Today
The Friends of SMU Libraries endowment fund was established in 1992 to secure a permanent source of funds to enhance the budgets of the SMU Libraries, to allow the Friends of SMU Libraries to provide continuous support not solely dependent on membership dues and to provide the staff necessary to support its activities. The Friends is committed to helping the libraries maintain their excellence. Since its founding 50 years ago, the Friends group has funded over $1,000,000 in library materials, services and equipment.

Dedman Law Centennial Scholarship Challenge
Your gift can make an SMU legal education even more attractive and feasible for bright students. Help us strengthen the law school's ability to offer financial aid packages that are competitive with other highly ranked schools, particularly for students with exceptional educational achievements and test scores.
To qualify for the challenge:
- Commit by May 31, 2026, at least $100,000 to support operational Dedman Law scholarships.
- Fully pay the gift within five years.
When your commitment is fulfilled, SMU Dedman School of Law will dedicate an equal amount to create a permanent endowed scholarship in your name to extend your impact on future students in perpetuity.
Dedman School of Law
By providing a cutting-edge legal education, Dedman School of Law trains students to become successful lawyers, business leaders, policy experts and legal counselors in fields ranging from corporate, intellectual property, entrepreneurship and blockchain technology law to public service, criminal and child advocacy law. Dedman Law continues to raise the bar for what a successful legal education looks like.
Founded in 1925, Dedman Law was the first law school in the city of Dallas and is celebrating its 100-year anniversary in February of 2025. Your contribution will aid in this legacy and will be instrumental in supporting our student recruitment efforts and experiences, experiential learning programs, and updating our facilities.

In 2024–2025, SMU joined the prestigious ACC and the Mustang Band welcomed its largest membership in SMU history with 110 students. The band expects to grow to 150 members within the next two years.
To make the most of this moment and stand out during national broadcasts, the Mustang Band needs new uniforms and equipment. The "best dressed band in the land" has a distinctive style and expansive wardrobe made up of varying combinations of pants, shirts, coats and ties. With your gift toward newly designed uniforms, we will honor Mustang Band heritage and its growing membership, improve fit for all students and allow up to 40 combinations of uniform pieces.
Your support enables the band to extend a legacy that began in 1917 of being a visible ambassador and custodian of school tradition, pageantry and campus pride.
SMU Libraries - Supporting Student Spaces
Funds raised will impact student success by helping to enhance student learning environments, promote collaboration with more group study spaces, and ensure that study spaces suit all students' needs in the years to come. Students rely upon these spaces to study for exams, devote time to research projects, and spend time with other Mustangs & your gift will ensure that students' needs will continue to be met in our library spaces.
Join us in making a lasting impact with your $100 donation!

The Spring 2026 semester marks an important milestone for the Women & LGBT Center, as we will be celebrating the 60th Anniversary of the annual Women's Symposium. Starting in 1966, the Women's Symposium was a trailblazing event hosted by SMU in conjunction with the rising feminist movement in Dallas. Over its incredible 60 years, the Symposium has brought together hundreds of SMU women and those across the DFW Metroplex to hear empowering speeches and celebrate the achievements of women in our community. Being one of SMU's oldest continuous traditions, the Women's Symposium needs our support now more than ever.

Since opening in 2016, the Crum Lacrosse Complex has hosted nearly a decade of competitive and recreational play for seven sport clubs, including Men’s Lacrosse, Women’s Lacrosse, Men’s Club Soccer, Women’s Club Soccer, Rugby Club, Ultimate Club, and Baseball Club.
By 2024, the turf field had reached the end of its lifespan. Safety reviews confirmed significant wear and raised concerns about performance and increased injury risk. The new field was replaced in summer 2025 and includes a shock-absorbing turf pad that reduces the risk of concussions as well as joint injuries. The new turf field is designed for a 15 year lifespan and should be in use until 2040, making it a smart investment in both player safety and facility longevity.
We humbly request your consideration in supporting the Crum Lacrosse Field Replacement Campaign. Your gift, whether large or small, will make a lasting impact on the wellbeing and success of SMU students.
